intro: Robinia pseudoacacia f. semperflorens, commonly known as the flowering honey locust, is a cultivar of the honey locust tree. It is characterized by its dense, thornless foliage and its ability to produce abundant white or yellow flowers throughout the growing season. The plant is native to the United States but has been widely introduced in other regions for ornamental purposes. Its botanical features include compound leaves that are often used in horticulture for their aesthetic value. The species is also valued for its adaptability to various soil types and its tolerance to urban environments.
